data.title: Editor doesn't detect typings in "typings/globals"
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.3.1
- OS Version: Windows 10, 64bit

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create a regular typescript project with the files provided below.
2. Remove the "*.txt" file endings to make them json files again (github doesn't allow *.json endings as attachments, sorry)
3. Run "npm install"
4. Run "typings install"
5. Create a *.ts file that imports the 'react' module
6. Look at the typescript error you are getting from the editor.

In short: any typings file that ends up in "typings/globals" will NOT be detected by the editor. However, when running through the typscript compiler, e.g. via webpack, everything's fine. It's only the editor, which is really annoying.

[tsconfig.json.txt](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/files/397458/tsconfig.json.txt)
[typings.json.txt](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/files/397456/typings.json.txt)
[package.json.txt](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/files/397457/package.json.txt)

data.title: VSCode Unable to Recognise default "program" in launch.json
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.3.1
- OS Version: Windows 7 Professional

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create a new Console Application using the powershell script: 
   
   ```
   function New-ConsoleApplication {
       param (
           [string]$Path,
           [string]$Name,
           [bool]$Open,
           [bool]$Run
       )
   
       New-Item -Name $Name -Type Directory -Path $Path
       cd "$Path\$Name"
       dotnet new
       dotnet restore 
       if ($Open){code .}
       if ($Run) {dotnet run}
   }
   
   New-ConsoleApplication -Name "ConsoleApplication" -Path "C:\Users\First.Surname\Source\" -Open $true -Run $true`
   ```
2. The folder structure and code is created, and it is opened in VSCode. The application executes and prints "Hello World!" to the PowerShell terminal.

**PowerShell Output:**

```
    Directory: C:\Users\Seb.Kotze\Source


    Mode                LastWriteTime     Length Name                              
    ----                -------------     ------ ----                              
    d----        02/08/2016     16:06            ConsoleApplication                
    Created new C# project in C:\Users\Seb.Kotze\Source\ConsoleApplication.
    log  : Restoring packages for C:\Users\Seb.Kotze\Source\ConsoleApplication\proj
    ect.json...
    log  : Writing lock file to disk. Path: C:\Users\Seb.Kotze\Source\ConsoleApplic
    ation\project.lock.json
    log  : C:\Users\Seb.Kotze\Source\ConsoleApplication\project.json
    log  : Restore completed in 2514ms.
    Project ConsoleApplication (.NETCoreApp,Version=v1.0) will be compiled because 
    expected outputs are missing
    Compiling ConsoleApplication for .NETCoreApp,Version=v1.0

    Compilation succeeded.
        0 Warning(s)
        0 Error(s)

    Time elapsed 00:00:01.5621203


    Hello World!
```
1. In VSCode, click `Debug` or `Ctrl` + `Shift` + `D`, then press `F5`
2. Select `.NET Core` as the environment - `launch.json` is opened - then press `F5` again
3. > No task runner configured
4. Select `Configure Task Runner` - select `.NET Core` - `tasks.json` is opened
5. Press `F5` to launch
6. > launch: launch.json must be configured. Change 'program' to the path to the executable file that you would like to debug.
7. open `launch.json` 
8. `Program` is given by : `"${workspaceRoot}/bin/Debug/<target-framework>/<project-name.dll>"`
9. Changing this to the physical path of the `.dll` resolves the issue, but `VSCode` complains that : 

> Relative paths will no longer be automatically converted to absolute ones. Consider using ${workspaceRoot} as a prefix.
> Path to the application dll or .NET Core host executable to launch. Example: '${workspaceRoot}/bin/Debug/<target-framework>/<project-name.dll>' where:
> <target-framework>: (example: 'netstandard1.5') This is the name of the framework that the app is being built for. It is set in the project.json file.
> <project-name>: (example: 'MyApp') The name of the project being debugged.

data.title: Error: Cannot find module
data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.3.1
- OS Version:windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1.compile my code,there's no error. 
2. press F5 to run it, the console output the error.it says it "Error: Cannot find module 'express'",but I have the express in my typings folder

my tsconfig.json is like the follows:

``` json
{
    "compilerOptions": {
        "target": "es6",
        "module": "commonjs",
        "outDir": "bin",
        "rootDir": "src",
        "sourceMap": true
    },
    "filesGlob": [
        "./src/**/*.ts",
        "./src/**/*.tsx",
        "!./node_modules/**/*.ts",
        "!./node_modules/**/*.tsx"
    ],
    "exclude": [
       "node_modules"
     ]
}
```

data.title: Debug: No call stack available ({_command}: Internal error: illegal access).
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.3.1 (e6b4afa53e9c0f54edef1673de9001e9f0f547ae, 2016-07-12T13:35:06.227Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 6.1.7601
- Node Version: v6.1.0

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create express.js Hello World
2. Create launch.js with `"runtimeExecutable": "C:\\Program Files (x86)\\nodejs\\node.exe"` (node and npm are not in PATH)
3. Set breakpoint on `res.send('Hello World!');`
4. Use Postman to send `GET /`

Expected:
Execution breaks at `res.send('Hello World!');` and Call Stack and Variables are populated

Actual:
Execution breaks with no location indication. Call Stack shows error message _No call stack available ({_command}: Internal error: illegal access)._

Other observations:
- Debugging worked fine a couple of hours after installation yesterday. Then issue started to occur. Could be worked around by restarting the app, but today that no longer helps.
- App runs fine, otherwise

Screenshot:
![code callstack invalidaccess](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11647669/17323703/6c2cc612-58a3-11e6-94e9-5aa7ed1ffb2b.png)

data.title: Equals character (=) is incorrectly escaped in plugin READMEs
data.body:
Begin installing the Ionide F# extension (Ionide-fsharp).

If you check out [the current README.md](https://github.com/ionide/ionide-vscode-fsharp/blob/4a2fbf0dc92bc6282144af74cd5d294a6935e9af/README.md#windows) on GitHub, you'll see that both Windows download links work.

Specifically, one of the links is to

``` text
https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=44011
```

However, when viewing the extension's README on Visual Studio Code, clicking on the first Windows download link brings you to

``` text
http://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id%3D44011
```

Notice the `=` has been escaped and replaced with `%3D`.

data.title: require('vscode') error in debug extension  vscode-mock-debug/out/mockDebug.js file
data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.3.1
- OS Version:ubuntu12.04

Steps to Reproduce:
1. I install mock-debug by the guide command below, it is no problem 
   git clone https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-mock-debug.git
   cd vscode-mock-debug
   npm install
2. vscode-mock-debug/out/extension.js file has the code var vscode = require('vscode') .I try to add var vscode = require('vscode') in vscode-mock-debug/out/mockDebug.js file for some test ,but when i press F5 to debug a read.md file , there is error show: Debug adapter process has terminated unexpectedly , In the console tab of developer tool shows [uncaught exception ]:Error read ECONNRESET. If I not add var vscode = require('vscode') will be ok .

As i checked there is vscode in the vscode-mock-debug/node_modules folder, and the extension.js file require('vscode') has no problem ,why in mockDebug.js is not ok . Is there anybody no this issue ? I am waiting for your reply ,thank you very much

data.title: Potential Optimization: Keep extra VSCode window hidden, ready to open?
data.body:
Just noticed that if I set VSCode as my default editor in the command line, via `EDITOR=code -w`, and then run a command that opens the default editor, like `git commit`, it takes quite a while for a new VSCode window to open and be ready for editing. I assume this is related to the overhead of starting a new Electron window, loading, parsing and initializing all the JavaScript for VSCode's interface and plugins.

Not sure if this has been considered or proposed before, but perhaps VSCode could pre-initialize an extra editor window in the background and keep it hidden. That way whenever `code -w` is invoked the window can appear to open instantaneously.

I figure some people might not appreciate the tradeoff of extra RAM consumption for startup performance, so maybe this could be disabled by a flag?
- VSCode Version:  1.3.1
- OS Version: OS X 10.11.6

data.title: Extension Development Host doesn't prompt to save dirty files on close
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.3.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

I noticed that if I make changes to files inside the extension development copy of Code then close those files (middle click on the tab, or click the X) then I do not get prompted to save; the changes are just discarded.

I've commented out all code in my `activate` method along with things like `grammar`s in `package.json` but it still happens. My main Code window _does_ prompt to save performing the same action.

I cloned one of your [sample repos](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode-wordcount) and I see the same behaviour running that.

data.title: [Feature Request] Navigate through explorer by typing start of file/folder name

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Any
- OS Version: Any

**Feature Proposal**
When opening a folder containing hundreds of items (for example: `node_modules`) There is no easy way to get to a child folder/file without scrolling around.

Would it be possible to allow the file viewer to navigate down to let's say the first file of the next letter keypressed?

```
node_modules (folder is highlighted)
    ( letter L is hit )
    ---- automatically scrolls down within node_modules to folders beginning with "L"
       +++ Folders shown:
       +  Lodash / etc
```

Just an idea, would help navigating large filesystems a bit easier.

Something is not working well regarding to the rating of extensions. I estimate only 1 out of 10,000 downloaders provide a rating.

I think it may be useful to provide a mechanism for rating/commenting inside the application rather than the Marketplace website. It can be also suggested to the user from time to time.

data.title: Inconsistent paste behavior with multiple cursors

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.3.1 (e6b4afa53e9c0f54edef1673de9001e9f0f547ae, 2016-07-12T13:35:06.227Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.10586

Steps to Reproduce:

1: With the following text

```
abcd
1234
abcd
1234

```

2: Select all occurrences of `1234` with two cursors
3: Cut and paste the content and the original text will be restored.
4: Extend the selection to include the trailing new line.
5: The output will now be

```
abcd
1234

1234
abcd
1234

1234

```

Expected result would be to have the original text restored.

![multicursor_copy_paste](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/807381/17299405/828b1fd4-580e-11e6-8434-0a89fb3621b9.gif)

data.title: Integrated Terminal : Allow Renaming sessions
data.body:
Please add a feature to rename sessions in the integrated terminal.
Usually one opens multiple terminal sessions using the same command like ssh. Then all these sessions are called ssh in the dropdown. Please allow to rename the session, so that its easy to choose.

data.title: Allow me to give a description to previewHtml command
data.body:
It's great that we can now set a label for previewHtml command, but can we also set a description so that we can provide additional information while we keep the label short and focused?

I've come to want this feature while I'm developing my extension. Here's the issue I've created on my repository: https://github.com/ryu1kn/vscode-annotator/issues/5

Thank you!

cf. https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/2351

data.title: Environment variables are not expanded when opening command window
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.3.1
- OS Version: Win 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create a new System environment variable (e.g. NODE_HOME=C:\Node)
2. Update System environment variable for PATH to be %NODE_HOME%;%PATH%
3. Restart windows
4. Open command prompt (e.g. Win-X, C) and enter 'set PATH' to see PATH=C:\Node;...
5. Open VSCode, right click on a file in explorer and select 'Open in Command Prompt'
6. Enter 'set PATH' and you see %NODE_HOME%;.. rather than "C:\Node;..." as in step 4.

data.title: regex sub match cannot work using replace in files
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.3.1
- OS Version: Windows 10 Pro

Steps to Reproduce:
1.  Create test1.txt and test2.txt with the same content as following:
   Test 300
   Test 301
   Test 302
2. I can use regex find all lines in both files through:
   `Test (3[0-9]*)`
   When I try replace in files with following regex:
   `Test $1-100`

both files become as following:
Test $1-100
Test $1-100
Test $1-100

Not as expected:
Test 300-100
Test 301-100
Test 302-100

However, the sub math replace works well in replace in single file.
